cz.zcu.validator.jdparser.api.javadocs.modifiers

Interface Paramable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JavaDocMethod

    public interface Paramable
    If JavaDoc element can have parameters, has to implement this interface.
    Author:
    Stepan Cais, scais@kiv.zcu.cz, 6.12.2012

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean allParametersHaveDescription()
      Check whether all parameters contain description.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getParameters()
      Returns parameters.
      boolean hasParametersUsed()
      Returns whether or not has the JavaDoc element parameters.
      void setParameters(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
      Sets parameters.

    • Method Detail

      • hasParametersUsed

        boolean hasParametersUsed()
        Returns whether or not has the JavaDoc element parameters. This means, that element has used the param annotation for it's parameters. This method does not control, whether the description of parameters exist, i.e. if element used param annotation without parameters description, this method will still return true.
        Returns:
        True, if has parameters, otherwise false.

      • allParametersHaveDescription

        boolean allParametersHaveDescription()
        Check whether all parameters contain description. Firstly, this method should call hasParametersUsed() and then checks whether all parameters have description.
        Returns:
        True, if all parameters have description, otherwise false.

      • getParameters

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getParameters()
        Returns parameters.
        Returns:
        Returns parameters.

      • setParameters

        void setParameters(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
        Sets parameters.
        Parameters:
        parameters - Parameters to set.
